topic.title: Sub Network Connection Protection Support

body.p: There are several schemes for SNCP (Sub Network Connection Protection). The implementations of these schemes are covered in section 14.1 of the G.798 specification in the ODU_C function section. In the COREOTN, several connection points described in the ODU_C connection function (of G.798) are implemented in the ODUk switch (OCPB), which can interconnect any channel from any of the three interfaces (line interface (LINEOTN), client interface (SYSOTN) and backplane (COPI) interface) in any combination. The COREOTN also supports broadcasting and dynamic channel selection of the various interfaces, which can be configured through software (serves as a bridge and select within the chip). Multicasting same source channel to multiple destination channels within same interface is not supported. Configuring the protection scheme is done by management software external to the device.
Note that ODUCn channels cannot be switched and are not allowed to be passed towards the fabric interface.

body.p: In the COREOTN, these protection schemes are enabled through the OCPB, which allows working and protect lines to be created by reconfiguring the output channels or allowing ODUk traffic to be connected to the customer ODUk fabric through a backplane interface.

The management layer can optionally insert/extract APS bytes or monitor the BDI/BEI/BIP-8 functions through any of the four stages of overhead insertion and extraction on a frame-by-frame basis. The hardware does not perform direct APS reconfiguration of channels based on incoming streams without a management layer indication. If reconfiguration of streams occurs (as in a 1:1 or 1:n cases), this operation can only occur at the ODUk switch. Hence, HO or MO ODUk containers cannot perform protection switching operations within the COREOTN subsystem.

The COREOTN also provides all the defects and SF/SD conditions in each layer processed in the ODUC_RFRM and ODTU_DMX to assist software with making a switch over via the external switch fabric or the ODUk switch located in the device.
To ease external hardware to realize fast protection switch criteria, a Defects port (DI_RCP) is provided which stream out all the relevant standards based defects for provisioned OTN and ENET links.

To realize SNC standards, a remote RCP is also provided within the subsystem. The remote RCP interface carries BDI/BIAE/BEI information for the provisioned operation TCM and PM layers on the device. This interface is an insert and extract interface, where remote TFRM/RFRM can be hooked up with the local ones. This interface also carries 1 level of APS bytes to extract and insert per channel, per framer stage.
